verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto Aaron, and say unto him, When thou lightest the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light over against the candlestick.
verses.ct: "Talk to Aaron and tell him: When you set up the lamps, all 7 lamps should cast their light toward the front of the lampstand."

verses.kjv: And Aaron did so; he lighted the lamps thereof over against the candlestick, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Aaron did exactly that — he positioned the lamps so they shone toward the front of the lampstand, just as the LORD had instructed Moses.

verses.kjv: And this work of the candlestick was of beaten gold, unto the shaft thereof, unto the flowers thereof, was beaten work: according unto the pattern which the LORD had shewed Moses, so he made the candlestick.
verses.ct: The lampstand was crafted from hammered gold, from its base all the way to its decorative flowers — entirely hammered metalwork. It was made according to the design the LORD had shown Moses.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Take the Levites from among the children of Israel, and cleanse them.
verses.ct: "Select the Levites from among the people of Israel and purify them.

verses.kjv: And thus shalt thou do unto them, to cleanse them: Sprinkle water of purifying upon them, and let them shave all their flesh, and let them wash their clothes, and so make themselves clean.
verses.ct: Here is what you must do to purify them: Sprinkle purification water on them, have them shave their entire bodies, have them wash their clothing, and in this way they will be made clean.

verses.kjv: Then let them take a young bullock with his meat offering, even fine flour mingled with oil, and another young bullock shalt thou take for a sin offering.
verses.ct: Then have them bring a young bull along with its grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil, and you are to take a second young bull as a sin offering.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt bring the Levites before the tabernacle of the congregation: and thou shalt gather the whole assembly of the children of Israel together:
verses.ct: Bring the Levites to the front of the tent of meeting, and gather the entire community of Israel together.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt bring the Levites before the LORD: and the children of Israel shall put their hands upon the Levites:
verses.ct: Present the Levites in the LORD's presence, and the people of Israel will place their hands on the Levites.

verses.kjv: And Aaron shall offer the Levites before the LORD for an offering of the children of Israel, that they may execute the service of the LORD.
verses.ct: Aaron will then present the Levites as an offering from the people of Israel to the LORD, so that they can carry out the LORD's work.

verses.kjv: And the Levites shall lay their hands upon the heads of the bullocks: and thou shalt offer the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, unto the LORD, to make an atonement for the Levites.
verses.ct: The Levites will place their hands on the heads of the bulls, and you will sacrifice one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to the LORD, to make atonement for the Levites.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt set the Levites before Aaron, and before his sons, and offer them for an offering unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Have the Levites stand in front of Aaron and his sons, and present them as an offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus shalt thou separate the Levites from among the children of Israel: and the Levites shall be mine.
verses.ct: In this way you will set the Levites apart from the rest of the people of Israel, and the Levites will belong to me.

verses.kjv: And after that shall the Levites go in to do the service of the tabernacle of the congregation: and thou shalt cleanse them, and offer them for an offering.
verses.ct: After this, the Levites may begin serving at the tent of meeting. You must purify them and present them as an offering.

verses.kjv: For they are wholly given unto me from among the children of Israel; instead of such as open every womb, even instead of the firstborn of all the children of Israel, have I taken them unto me.
verses.ct: They are completely dedicated to me from among the people of Israel. I have taken them as my own in place of every firstborn — the first child from every mother among the Israelites.

verses.kjv: For all the firstborn of the children of Israel are mine, both man and beast: on the day that I smote every firstborn in the land of Egypt I sanctified them for myself.
verses.ct: Every firstborn among the people of Israel belongs to me, whether human or animal. On the day I struck down every firstborn in the land of Egypt, I set them apart as my own.

verses.kjv: And I have taken the Levites for all the firstborn of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: I have taken the Levites as substitutes for all the firstborn among the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and to his sons from among the children of Israel, to do the service of the children of Israel in the tabernacle of the congregation, and to make an atonement for the children of Israel: that there be no plague among the children of Israel, when the children of Israel come nigh unto the sanctuary.
verses.ct: I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and his sons from among the people of Israel, to perform the service on behalf of the Israelites at the tent of meeting and to make atonement for the people of Israel, so that no plague will strike the Israelites when they come near the sanctuary."

verses.kjv: And Moses, and Aaron, and all the congregation of the children of Israel, did to the Levites according unto all that the LORD commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so did the children of Israel unto them.
verses.ct: Moses, Aaron, and the entire Israelite community did everything regarding the Levites exactly as the LORD had commanded Moses. That is precisely what the Israelites did.

verses.kjv: And the Levites were purified, and they washed their clothes; and Aaron offered them as an offering before the LORD; and Aaron made an atonement for them to cleanse them.
verses.ct: The Levites went through purification and washed their clothing. Aaron presented them as an offering in the LORD's presence and made atonement for them to make them clean.

verses.kjv: And after that went the Levites in to do their service in the tabernacle of the congregation before Aaron, and before his sons: as the LORD had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so did they unto them.
verses.ct: After that, the Levites began their duties at the tent of meeting under the direction of Aaron and his sons. Everything was done regarding the Levites just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: This is it that belongeth unto the Levites: from twenty and five years old and upward they shall go in to wait upon the service of the tabernacle of the congregation:
verses.ct: "This is the regulation for the Levites: Starting at age 25, they will enter service and work at the tent of meeting.

verses.kjv: And from the age of fifty years they shall cease waiting upon the service thereof, and shall serve no more:
verses.ct: But at age 50, they must step back from their regular duties and no longer serve in that capacity.

verses.kjv: But shall minister with their brethren in the tabernacle of the congregation, to keep the charge, and shall do no service. Thus shalt thou do unto the Levites touching their charge.
verses.ct: They may assist their brothers at the tent of meeting by helping with various responsibilities, but they are not to perform the regular service themselves. This is how you are to arrange the duties of the Levites."
